#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A WRITER'S REQUEST OF HIS
#Text=MASTER
#Text=Let me never tag a moral to a story , nor tell a story without a meaning .
#Text=Make me respect my material so much that I dare not slight my work .
#Text=Help me to deal very honestly with words and with people because they are both alive .
#Text=Show me that as in a river , so in a writing , clearness is the best quality , and a little that is pure is worth more than much that is mixed .
#Text=Teach me to see the local colour without being blind to the inner light .
#Text=Give me an ideal that will stand the strain of weaving into human stuff on the loom of the real .
#Text=Keep me from caring more for books than for folks , for art than for life .
#Text=Steady me to do my full stint of work as well as I can : and when that is done , stop me , pay what wages Thou wilt , and help me to say , from a quiet heart , a grateful AMEN .
#Text=PREFACE
#Text=In every life worth writing about there is a ruling passion , -- “the very pulse of the machine . ”
#Text=Unless you touch that , you are groping around outside of reality .
#Text=Sometimes it is romantic love : Natures masterpiece of interested benevolence .
#Text=In almost all lives this passion has its season of empire .
#Text=Therefore , and rightly , it is the favourite theme of the storyteller .
#Text=Romantic love interests almost everybody , because almost everybody knows something about it , or would like to know .
#Text=But there are other passions , no less real , which also have their place and power in human life .
#Text=Some of them come earlier , and sometimes they last longer , than romantic love .
#Text=They play alongside of it and are mixed up with it , now checking it , now advancing its flow and tingeing it with their own colour .
#Text=Just because love is so universal , it is often to one of the other passions that we must look for the distinctive hue , the individual quality of a life-story .
#Text=Granted , if you will , that everybody must fall in love , or ought to fall in love , How will he do it ?
#Text=And what will he do afterwards ?
#Text=These are questions not without interest to one who watches the human drama as a friend .
#Text=The answers depend upon those hidden and durable desires , affections , and impulses to which men and women give themselves up for rule and guidance .

#Text=Music , nature , children , honour , strife , revenge , money , pride , friendship , loyalty , duty , -- to these objects and others like them the secret power of personal passion often turns , and the life unconsciously follows it , as the tides in the sea follow the moon in the sky .

#Text=When circumstances cross the ruling passion , when rocks lie in the way and winds are contrary , then things happen , characters emerge , slight events are significant , mere adventures are transformed into a real plot .
#Text=What care I how many “ hair-breadth ' scapes ” and “ moving accidents ” your hero may pass through , unless I know him for a man ?
#Text=He is but a puppet strung on wires .
#Text=His kisses are wooden and his wounds bleed sawdust .
#Text=There is nothing about him to remember except his name , and perhaps a bit of dialect .
#Text=Kill him or crown him , -- what difference does it make ?
#Text=But go the other way about your work :
#Text=“ Take the least man of all mankind , as I ; Look at his head and heart , find how and why He differs from his fellows utterly , ” --
#Text=and now there is something to tell , with a meaning .
#Text=If you tell it at length , it is a novel , -- a painting .
#Text=If you tell it in brief , it is a short story , -- an etching .
#Text=But the subject is always the same : the unseen , mysterious , ruling passion weaving the stuff of human nature into patterns wherein the soul is imaged and revealed .
#Text=To tell about some of these ruling passions , simply , clearly , and concretely , is what I want to do in this book .
#Text=The characters are chosen , for the most part , among plain people , because their feelings are expressed with fewer words and greater truth , not being costumed for social effect .
#Text=The scene is laid on Nature 's stage because I like to be out-of-doors , even when I am trying to think and learning to write .
#Text=“ Avalon , ” Princeton , July 22 , 1901 .

#Text=VIII .
#Text=The Keeper of the Light
#Text=I. A LOVER OF MUSIC
#Text=I
#Text=He entered the backwoods village of Bytown literally on the wings of the wind .
#Text=It whirled him along like a big snowflake , and dropped him at the door of Moody 's “ Sportsmen 's Retreat , ” as if he were a New Year 's gift from the North Pole .
#Text=His coming seemed a mere chance ; but perhaps there was something more in it , after all .
#Text=At all events , you shall hear , if you will , the time and the manner of his arrival .
#Text=It was the last night of December , some thirty-five years ago .

#Text=All the city sportsmen who had hunted the deer under Bill Moody 's direction had long since retreated to their homes , leaving the little settlement on the border of the Adirondack wilderness wholly under the social direction of the natives .
#Text=The annual ball was in full swing in the dining-room of the hotel .
#Text=At one side of the room the tables and chairs were piled up , with their legs projecting in the air like a thicket of very dead trees .
